message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CVPR 

This paper proposes a novel technique for visual localization in robotic mapping applications that is based on deep-learning-based object features and SIFT point-features. The paper focuses on improving the robustness of localization under large changes in scale, which is a common problem in robotic mapping. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also evaluates the proposed technique on the KITTI Odometry benchmark, which is a popular benchmark for robotics and autonomous driving research, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.RO (Robotics). The paper uses deep learning techniques, which could also make it relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper was published in arXiv just before the CVPR 2020 conference, which suggests that it could be relevant to the conference and therefore to the cs.CVPR sub-category.
